backend_llm_notes: Claude Sonnet 4.5 via Cursor Agent Mode - Advanced reasoning and instruction following
original_prompt: Keep my Calendar up to date by committing to only meetings that are part of my priorities.

gutts.name: Priority Definition & Extraction
gutts.capability: Identify and structure user's priorities from context, goals, and stated objectives
gutts.user_goal: System understands what matters to the user for decision-making
gutts.evidence: Would extract priorities from user profile, past decisions, or explicit statements

gutts.name: Calendar Event Retrieval
gutts.capability: Access and load pending calendar invitations and scheduled meetings requiring decisions
gutts.user_goal: Get all meetings that need accept/decline decisions
gutts.evidence: Calendar API query for events with pending RSVP status

gutts.name: Meeting-Priority Alignment Scoring
gutts.capability: Evaluate how well each meeting aligns with stated priorities using semantic matching and relevance scoring
gutts.user_goal: Know which meetings support goals and which don't
gutts.evidence: Scoring algorithm comparing meeting attributes to priority rules

gutts.name: Accept/Decline Decision Logic
gutts.capability: Determine which meetings to accept vs decline based on priority alignment thresholds and constraints
gutts.user_goal: Automated keep/decline recommendations aligned with priorities
gutts.evidence: Decision rules applied to alignment scores to generate accept/decline actions

gutts.name: Calendar Action Execution
gutts.capability: Execute accept/decline actions on calendar system by updating RSVP status
gutts.evidence: Calendar API calls to update meeting RSVP responses

gutts.name: Decision Justification & Reporting
gutts.capability: Explain why each meeting was accepted or declined with explicit linkage to priority rules
gutts.user_goal: Understand the reasoning behind each calendar decision
gutts.evidence: Generated explanations linking decisions to specific priorities and alignment scores

notes: Generated by Claude Sonnet 4.5 - Matches reference decomposition of 6 GUTTs
